content:
With 1.5 hours to spare, we can create a well-rounded morning routine that fits your priorities. Here's a suggested schedule for you:

**7:30 AM - Wake Up**

* Take a few deep breaths, stretch, and get out of bed

**7:40 AM - Exercise (30 minutes)**

* You can choose one or a combination of the following:
	+ Brisk walking
	+ Yoga or stretching
	+ Bodyweight exercises (push-ups, squats, lunges, etc.)
	+ Jumping jacks or dance to your favorite music
	+ Quick 30-minute workout video at home

**8:10 AM - Shower and Get Ready (20 minutes)**

* Take a refreshing shower to wake yourself up
* Get dressed in comfortable work attire
* Brush your teeth, wash your face, and style your hair

**8:30 AM - Breakfast (30 minutes)**

* Prepare a healthy breakfast that you enjoy (e.g., oatmeal, scrambled eggs, whole-grain toast, fruit, etc.)
* Take your time eating and savor your meal
* You can also use this time to catch up on news, scroll through social media, or read a book

**9:00 AM - Final Preparations (10 minutes)**

* Gather your belongings (lunch, water bottle, bag, etc.)
* Double-check your schedule for the day
* Take a few deep breaths to mentally prepare for the day ahead

This routine allows you to fit in exercise, breakfast, and getting ready for work within your 1.5-hour window. You can adjust the schedule as needed to fit your personal preferences and pace. Remember to be flexible and make adjustments as you go along.

Tips to help you stick to your routine:

* Set your alarm clock 15 minutes earlier each day to gradually adjust to the new wake-up time.
* Prepare your workout gear or breakfast ingredients the night before to save time in the morning.
* Use a timer to keep yourself on track and ensure you're not spending too much time on any one activity.
* Make mornings enjoyable by listening to uplifting music or a favorite podcast while you get ready.

How does this routine sound? Do you have any questions or would you like to make any changes?
